‍ONE STEP AHEAD OF THE GAME.Definition: ahead of everyone else, already ahead

‍FRESHWATER.Definition: of or found in freshwater; not of the sea

‍PLETHORA.Definition: a large or excessive amount of something

‍CARCASSES.Definition: the structural framework or remains of a building, ship, or piece of furniture

‍HAPHAZARD.Definition: without any obvious principle of organisation

‍BASIN.Definition: a circular or oval valley or natural depression on the earth's surface, especially one containing water

ACRES.Definition: a unit of land area equal to 0.405 hectares

‍IRRIGATE.Definition: supply water to (land or crops) to help growth, typically by means of channels

‍RESERVOIRS.Definition: large natural or artificial lakes used as a source of water supply

‍SALINITY.Definition: the amount of salt in a liquid

‍CONTAMINATED.Definition: having been made impure by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance

FERTILIZER.Definition: a chemical or natural substance added to land to increase its fertility

PESTICIDES.Definition: a substance used for destroying insects or other organisms harmful to cultivated plants or to animals

SOIL.Definition: the upper layer of earth in which plants grow

‍CUTTING OFF.Definition: an act of stopping or interrupting the supply of something

LIGHT AT THE END OF THIS TUNNEL.Definition: an indication that a long period of difficulty is nearing an end

‍JEOPARDISE.Definition: put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure

LIVELIHOOD.Definition: a means of securing the necessities of life

‍INEXORABLY.Definition: in a way that is impossible to stop or prevent
